results.title: Museum explains scientific progress
results.creator_credit: Museum of Applied Science and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Shows the displays and models of the Melbourne Museum of Applied Science. Stresses the craftsmanship which is applied to the explanatory models, such as those shown - the artificial moons and the rockets now probing into space.

results.title: Museum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Lieberman, Saul J. Turell and Janus Films
results.brief_description: This film looks at the work of staff in museums across the United States. The operation of a modern museum is shown: excavation, conservation, exhibition and education. Selected museum objects are shown being handled by professionals from acquisition to exhibition. The installation of the Tutankhamen exhibition at the Metropolitan Museum of Art is shown.

results.title: Muscular system [color]
results.brief_description: This film looks at the three types of muscle in the human musculature system. The structure of the muscle, the nerve impulse and the chemical process of muscular movement are explained.

results.title: Muscular strength and endurance
results.creator_credit: D. David Bash and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Everyone’s a Winner”.
Describes a program for developing strength and endurance of the upper body, arms and abdominal muscles. Includes the correct ways to do knee-bent situps, chair pushups and pullups, and how to limber up before exercising.

group_siblings.title: Heart-lung endurance
group_siblings.creator_credit: D. David Bash and BFA Educational Media

results.title: Muscular and mechanical movements
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Digestion”.
Deals with the muscular processes involved in the digestion of food. The film demonstrates mechanical and muscular processes of mastication and swallowing; peristalsis in the oesophagus, small intestine, and colon; segmentation in the small intestine; contraction waves in the cardiac and pyloric regions of the stomach; absorption of food into the blood from the small intestine, and of water and salts from the colon. No other credits available.

results.title: Muscles and movement
results.creator_credit: Jack Smith and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Body”.
Designed for 11 to 14 year olds, the film illustrates aspects of the skeleton and muscles, using resources not available in the classroom or school laboratory. Uses clinical techniques, anatomical models and preparations selected to demonstrate body functions.

results.title: Muscles and bones of the body
results.brief_description: The importance of the muscles and bones to the internal and external functioning of the human body. How tendons, joints, muscles and the bones of the skeleton work smoothly together as one unit. The difference between voluntary and involuntary muscles and the importance of proper exercise and diet to a healthy body.
results.description: The importance of the muscles and bones to the internal and external functioning of the human body. results.title: Muscle
results.creator_credit: Barry Lank, Andreas Poulsson and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Pat Feras, who is a social worker by profession, spends most of her leisure hours body building. This film shows Pat training for, and competing in, a women’s body building championship and includes fascinating footage, of the championship, both from backstage and upfront.
